CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1969, pg. 19, reads: "'TWAS THE NIGHT BEFORE XMAS...and all through the house there wasn't even a mouse...only two little boys named Jerry and Joseph who got mixed in their dates, and waited till then to wite to St. Nick. Send me a horse Jerry Bascomb kept writing...I want a motor cycle little Joe his twin put in his note; one that roars and performs like motor cycles should.  And because they were late writing their letters, they did their Santa thing in front of the fire.  Just what they'll get is more than can be told, but they've tried hard to dig Santa, the big and the bold.  - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Twin brothers Jerry and Joseph Bascomb wearing pajamas and holding pens, lying on floor with fireplace in background, in Charles "Teenie" Harris' house at 7604 Mulford Street
